ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: Seeking an engineer wanting a challenging Test Engineering position in wireless communication. Individuals will work with RFIC circuit designers and system integration engineers to do: Bench testing, debugging, and characterizing RF Wireless SoC performance. Individuals are expected to automate tasks where tasks are done repeatedly or require a high amount of setup.

ul.li: •Strong wireless RF/PHY/MAC experience including objected oriented programming experience such as Python
•Expertise in test and script development (eg. Python but at a minimum Unix scripting knowledge is a requirement. )
•Working knowledge of RF test equipment (network analyzer, spectrum analyzer, vector signal analyzer, vector signal generator, etc.).
•Candidates should be comfortable in a lab environment and have a minimum of 5+ years experience
•Expect candidates to be proficient with basic metrics for determining quality of digital communication signals measured.
•Having experience with RF parametric testing and loadpull testing are highly desirable.

div.p: •Executing and implementing directed RF/PHY/MAC testing scripts, which control and setup RF test equipment. •Executing and implementing scripts that plot, parse and analyze large data sets •Generating RF design/validation/test reports by interfacing with RF and systems and integration teams to design such reports. •Hands-on measurements, development of automated tests & test platforms, data processing, etc. •Work collaboratively with team members
